title: Chess
benefits: Improves concentration and memory; develops problem-solving skills; boosts strategic and critical thinking; encourages patience and planning; suitable for all ages.
drawback: Not physically active; long games can feel slow; may be intimidating for beginners; limited appeal for those seeking fast-paced games.

title: Carrom
benefits: Enhances hand-eye coordination; improves focus and aim; promotes social interaction; can be enjoyed casually or competitively; fun for all age groups.
drawback: Requires flat surface and board; small coins can be choking hazard for children; not physically engaging; skill differences can discourage beginners.

title: Ludo
benefits: Simple and family-friendly; teaches patience and turn-taking; promotes bonding; luck element keeps it exciting for kids; easy to learn.
drawback: Relies heavily on dice luck (less strategy); can drag on; older players may find it repetitive; limited skill development.

title: Table Tennis
benefits: Improves reflexes and hand-eye coordination; burns calories; boosts concentration; suitable for small indoor spaces; competitive and fast-paced.
drawback: Requires table and paddles; risk of wrist/elbow strain; limited space in small homes; balls can get lost easily.

title: Billiards / Snooker
benefits: Enhances focus, patience, and precision; promotes strategic thinking; social and relaxing; develops fine motor skills.
drawback: Requires large indoor space and expensive table; not physically demanding; long playtime; can feel slow-paced for some.

title: Card Games (e.g., Uno, Poker)
benefits: Encourages strategic thinking; improves memory and math skills; portable and inexpensive; wide variety of games available; promotes social bonding.
drawback: Luck can overshadow skill; addictive gambling risks in certain card games; cards can wear out; may cause conflicts if competitive.

title: Puzzle Games
benefits: Boosts problem-solving skills; improves memory and focus; reduces stress; good for solo play; enhances creativity and patience.
drawback: Can be frustrating if too hard; not physically active; takes long time to complete large puzzles; limited replay value once solved.

title: Video Games
benefits: Improves reflexes, multitasking, and decision-making; highly entertaining; wide variety of genres; online play fosters social connections; can improve hand-eye coordination.
drawback: Excessive screen time harms health; can cause addiction; sedentary lifestyle risks; may impact sleep patterns; cost of consoles/games.

title: Board Games (e.g., Monopoly, Scrabble)
benefits: Enhances vocabulary, math, and strategy; promotes family bonding; improves patience and negotiation skills; portable and affordable.
drawback: Games can drag on; disputes may arise over rules; pieces/cards can get lost; limited physical activity.

title: Indoor Yoga
benefits: Improves flexibility and strength; reduces stress; enhances concentration; suitable for all ages; can be done without special equipment.
drawback: Requires quiet space; beginners may need guidance; not competitive (less exciting for some); risk of strain if postures are incorrect.
